hypothesis: Markets priced in the 40-60% uncertain zone exhibit systematic NO bias - YES outcomes are overpriced by 15-17%
learnings: YES outcomes in 40-60% price range are systematically overpriced across 351K resolved outcomes
Edge is strongest near 50% (v7: 0.45-0.55 has Sharpe 6.12 vs v5: 0.40-0.60 has Sharpe 4.92)
Edge is 5x stronger in low-volume markets (Sharpe 8.88) vs high-volume (Sharpe 1.67) - expect live performance closer to high-vol figures
CRITICAL: Original backtest used last snapshot (<5min before close) which is not executable - re-analysis at 1-4h entry window shows 65.7% WR, Sharpe 5.09
Best entry windows are 1-4h (Sharpe 5.09) or 24-48h (Sharpe 5.60) before close
Liquidity IS being collected in live system (99.6% coverage)
action: paper trade no_bias_uncertain_zone for 4 weeks with $25 max position, enter 1-4h before close

hypothesis: Uncertain zone NO bias is timing-dependent - optimize across full time window and price band spectrum. Small sample size in 1h variant may explain poor live performance.
learnings: 12-36h window is optimal for uncertain zone NO bias (Sharpe 8.57 vs 4.86 for 1-4h)
$2,000 volume threshold provides best risk-adjusted returns (Sharpe 7.42)
Lower liquidity = higher win rate (61% at $100) but higher variance - live will track higher-vol performance
Edge is robust across all time splits and liquidity splits (100% consistency)
1h variant edge EXISTS in backtest (Sharpe 4.86) but execution challenges near expiry degrade live performance
Sports category shows stronger NO bias (Sharpe 6.38) than Crypto (Sharpe 3.98)
72-168h window is second best (Sharpe 7.54, WR 58.6%, PF 1.42) - good for diversification
action: Deploy v3 (12-36h) as primary strategy, keep v6 (72-168h) for diversification, kill uncertain_zone_1h

hypothesis: Markets with YES priced 0.55-0.95 (favorites) systematically overestimate YES probability - betting NO captures ~15-20% edge
learnings: NO bias extends well beyond uncertain zone (exp-001/002) into favorite territory (YES > 0.55)
Higher YES threshold = stronger edge: v4 (0.70-0.95) Sharpe 19.1 vs v1 (0.55-0.95) Sharpe 14.9
Category matters: Weather/Science/Tech 84-89% WR, Business weak at 55% WR - consider category filtering
Edge persists across all time windows (12-168h) and volume filters ($100-$5000)
Liquidity split shows low-liq higher edge (77% WR) but high-liq still strong (69% WR) - expect live to track high-liq
All 15 variants passed all kill criteria - exceptionally robust signal
action: Deploy as favorite_no_bias strategy: YES 0.70-0.95, 12-168h, $500 min volume, $50 max position, 2-week paper trade

hypothesis: Live performance analysis of top 5 strategies reveals category-specific edge concentration and outlier-driven returns in longshots
learnings: NO bias 2h strategy: ESPORTS drives 77% of P&L ($134.97); WEATHER (0% WR) and OTHER (0% WR) are pure drains
NO bias 2h strategy: MAP_WINNER L3 has 46.2% WR vs MATCH_WINNER at 94.1% WR - individual map bets have REVERSE bias compared to series outcomes
NO bias 12h crypto: DIRECTION_HOURLY has 1.8x edge per trade ($0.33) vs DIRECTION_15MIN ($0.18) despite similar win rates
Longshot strategies: 85-90% of all profits came from 4 correlated stock price bets (META, MSFT, GOOGL) on Dec 26 - true Sharpe is 0.09-0.12 without outliers, not 0.19-0.24
Longshot time window: 2-6h is NOT optimal after removing outliers; 24h+ windows are actually better
SOCCER_OTHER L2 in crypto 12h: 28.6% WR, -$1.66/trade - brutal underperformer
ENTERTAINMENT category in longshots: 83% WR but net negative P&L (-$3.44) - high WR masks larger losses when wrong
action: Deploy no_bias_tight_2h_filtered (excl WEATHER/OTHER/MAP_WINNER) and no_bias_tight_12h_hourly (DIRECTION_HOURLY only)
code_changes: Added L2/L3 category filtering to UncertainZoneStrategy (v2.4.0)

hypothesis: Bottom 10 strategies performance review - identify failure patterns and document learnings for future strategy design
learnings: FAVORITE BIAS (YES 0.70-0.95) DOES NOT EXIST IN LIVE: All 5 favorite_no variants failed catastrophically (12-21% WR vs 73% backtest). Backtest-to-live gap is 50+ percentage points.
CRYPTO has REVERSE bias in favorite zone: 0% WR across all favorite strategies. Do NOT bet NO on crypto favorites.
POLITICS has 0% WR in favorite zone: favorite_no_24_96h_v100_no_crypto_sports had 0/10 wins on politics.
UNDERDOG NO (YES 0.55-0.70) DOES NOT WORK: 34-39% WR across all time windows. The 'cheap NO' thesis is wrong - cheap NOs are cheap for a reason.
2h TIGHT WINDOW alone is insufficient: no_bias_tight_2h (43.8% WR) and no_bias_tight_2h_no_sports (43.1% WR) both lost money. Edge requires additional filters (category exclusions, L3 filtering).
SPORTS exclusion HURTS tight bucket strategies: no_bias_tight_2h_no_sports performed worse than no_bias_tight_2h_no_crypto_sports which kept sports.
CSGO MOMENTUM strategy failed: 35% WR, -$8.11/trade. Momentum signals don't persist long enough in esports.
HIGH-CONVICTION SIZING (10%) backfires on uncertain edges: favorite_no_24_96h_top_cats lost $190 with 10% sizing despite smaller trade count.
BACKTEST WIN RATES > 70% are suspect: Every strategy with backtest WR > 70% failed in live. True live WR is typically 20-30 points lower.
VOLUME FILTERS don't save broken strategies: $100, $500 variants of favorite_no all failed equally.
kill_reason: All 10 strategies have negative expectancy in live trading. Favorite bias does not exist. Underdog bias does not exist. Tight 2h window needs category/L3 filters.
action: Remove all 10 strategies from strategies.yaml. Do not deploy any favorite_no or underdog_no variants without extensive live paper testing.
